96.name: Dwarf Scroll I
96.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a red bow.

97.name: Dwarf Scroll II
97.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a green ribbon.

98.name: Dwarf Scroll III
98.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a blue rope.

99.name: Dwarf Scroll IV
99.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a golden chain.

100.name: Chipped Amphora
100.description: An ancient vessel made of ceramic material. Used to transport both dry and wet goods.

101.name: Arrowhead
101.description: A crudely fashioned point used for hunting.

103.name: Ancient Doll
103.description: An ancient doll covered in grime. This doll may have been used as a toy, a decoration, or a prop in some kind of ritual.

104.name: Elvish Jewelry
104.description: Dirty but still beautiful. On the side is a flowing script thought by some to be the ancient language of the elves. No Elvish bones have ever been found.

105.name: Chewing Stick
105.description: Ancient people chewed on these to keep their teeth clean.

106.name: Ornamental Fan
106.description: This exquisute fan most likely belonged to a noblewoman. Historians believe that the valley was a popular sixth-era vacation spot for the wealthy.

107.name: Dinosaur Egg
107.description: A giant dino egg... The entire shell is still intact!

108.name: Rare Disc
108.description: A heavy black disc studded with peculiar red stones. When you hold it, you're overwhelmed with a feeling of dread.

109.name: Ancient Sword
109.description: It's the remains of an ancient sword. Most of the blade has turned to rust, but the hilt is very finely crafted.

110.name: Rusty Spoon
110.description: A plain old spoon, probably ten years old. Not very interesting.

111.name: Rusty Spur
111.description: An old spur that was once attached to a cowboy's boot. People must have been raising animals in this area for many generations.

112.name: Rusty Cog
112.description: A well preserved cog that must have been part of some ancient machine. This could be dwarven technology.

113.name: Chicken Statue
113.description: It's a statue of a chicken on a bronze base. The ancient people of this area must have been very fond of chickens.

114.name: Ancient Seed
114.description: It's a dry old seed from some ancient plant. By all appearances it's long since dead...

115.name: Prehistoric Tool
115.description: Some kind of gnarly old digging tool.

116.name: Dried Starfish
116.description: A starfish from the primordial ocean. It's an unusually pristine specimen!

117.name: Anchor
117.description: It may have belonged to ancient pirates.

118.name: Glass Shards
118.description: A mixture of glass shards smoothed by centuries of ocean surf. These could have belonged to an ancient mosaic or necklace.

119.name: Bone Flute
119.description: It's a prehistoric wind instrument carved from an animal's bone. It produces an eerie tone.

120.name: Prehistoric Handaxe
120.description: One of the earliest tools employed by humans. This "crude" tool was created by striking one rock with another to form a sharp edge.

121.name: Dwarvish Helm
121.description: It's one of the helmets commonly worn by dwarves. The thick metal plating protects them from falling debris and stalactites.

122.name: Dwarf Gadget
122.description: It's a piece of the advanced technology once known to the dwarves. It's still glowing and humming, but you're unable to understand how it works.

123.name: Ancient Drum
123.description: It's a drum made from wood and animal skin. It has a low, reverberating tone.

124.name: Golden Mask
124.description: A creepy golden mask probably used in an ancient magic ritual. A socket in the forehead contains a large purple gemstone.

125.name: Golden Relic
125.description: It's a golden slab with heiroglyphs and pictures emblazoned onto the front.

579.name: Prehistoric Scapula
579.description: Commonly known as a "shoulder blade"... It's unclear what species it belonged to.

580.name: Prehistoric Tibia
580.description: A thick and sturdy leg bone.

581.name: Prehistoric Skull
581.description: This is definitely a mammalian skull.

582.name: Skeletal Hand
582.description: It's a wonder all these ancient little pieces lasted so long.

583.name: Prehistoric Rib
583.description: Little gouge marks on the side suggest that this rib was someone's dinner.

584.name: Prehistoric Vertebra
584.description: A segment of some prehistoric creature's spine.

585.name: Skeletal Tail
585.description: It's pretty short for a tail.

586.name: Nautilus Fossil
586.description: This must've washed up ages ago from an ancient coral reef.

587.name: Amphibian Fossil
587.description: The relatively short hind legs suggest some kind of primordial toad.

588.name: Palm Fossil
588.description: Palm Fossils are relatively common, but this happens to be a particularly well-preserved specimen.

589.name: Trilobite
589.description: A long extinct relative of the crab.

60.name: Emerald
60.description: A precious stone with a brilliant green color.

64.name: Ruby
64.description: A precious stone that is sought after for its rich color and beautiful luster.

68.name: Topaz
68.description: Fairly common but still prized for its beauty.

74.name: Prismatic Shard
74.description: A very rare and powerful substance with unknown origins.

80.name: Quartz
80.description: A clear crystal commonly found in caves and mines.

82.name: Fire Quartz
82.description: A glowing red crystal commonly found near hot lava.

84.name: Frozen Tear
84.description: A crystal fabled to be the frozen tears of a yeti.

86.name: Earth Crystal
86.description: A resinous substance found near the surface.

538.name: Alamite
538.description: Its distinctive fluorescence makes it a favorite among rock collectors.

539.name: Bixite
539.description: A dark metallic Mineral sought after for its cubic structure.

540.name: Baryte
540.description: The best specimens resemble a desert rose.

542.name: Calcite
542.description: This yellow crystal is speckled with shimmering nodules.

543.name: Dolomite
543.description: It can occur in coral reefs, often near an underwater volcano.

544.name: Esperite
544.description: The crystals glow bright green when stimulated.

545.name: Fluorapatite
545.description: Small amounts are found in human teeth.

547.name: Helvite
547.description: It grows in a triangular column.

548.name: Jamborite
548.description: The crystals are so tightly packed it almost looks fuzzy.

549.name: Jagoite
549.description: A high volume of tiny crystals makes it very glittery.

550.name: Kyanite
550.description: The geometric faces are as smooth as glass.

551.name: Lunarite
551.description: The cratered white orbs form a tight cluster.

552.name: Malachite
552.description: A popular ornamental stone, used in sculpture and to make green paint.

553.name: Neptunite
553.description: A jet-black crystal that is unusually reflective.

554.name: Lemon Stone
554.description: Some claim the powdered crystal is a dwarvish delicacy.

555.name: Nekoite
555.description: The delicate shards form a tiny pink meadow.

556.name: Orpiment
556.description: Despite its high toxicity, this Mineral is widely used in manufacturing and folk medicine.

557.name: Petrified Slime
557.description: This little guy may be 100,000 years old.

558.name: Thunder Egg
558.description: According to legend, angry thunder spirits would throw these stones at one another.

560.name: Ocean Stone
560.description: An old legend claims these stones are the mosaics of ancient mermaids.

561.name: Ghost Crystal
561.description: There is an aura of coldness around this crystal.

562.name: Tigerseye
562.description: A stripe of shimmering gold gives this gem a warm luster.

563.name: Jasper
563.description: When polished, this stone becomes attractively luminous. Prized by ancient peoples for thousands of years.

564.name: Opal
564.description: Its internal structure causes it to reflect a rainbow of light.

565.name: Fire Opal
565.description: A rare variety of opal, named for its red spots.

566.name: Celestine
566.description: Some early life forms had bones made from this.

567.name: Marble
567.description: A very popular material for sculptures and construction.

568.name: Sandstone
568.description: A common type of stone with red and brown striations.

569.name: Granite
569.description: A speckled Mineral that is commonly used in construction.

571.name: Limestone
571.description: A very common type of stone. It's not worth very much.

572.name: Soapstone
572.description: Because of its relatively soft consistency, this stone is very popular for carving.

573.name: Hematite
573.description: An iron-based Mineral with interesting magnetic properties.

574.name: Mudstone
574.description: A fine-grained rock made from ancient clay or mud.

575.name: Obsidian
575.description: A volcanic glass that forms when lava cools rapidly.

576.name: Slate
576.description: It's extremely resistant to water, making it a good roofing material.

577.name: Fairy Stone
577.description: An old miner's song suggests these are made from the bones of ancient fairies.

578.name: Star Shards
578.description: No one knows how these form. Some scientists claim that the microscopic structure displays unnatural regularity.
